title: ls
content: List directory contents, showing files and folders.

title: cd
content: Change the current working directory.

title: pwd
content: Print the current working directory path.

title: mkdir
content: Create a new directory.

title: rmdir
content: Remove an empty directory.

title: cp
content: Copy files or directories.

title: mv
content: Move or rename files or directories.

title: rm
content: Delete files or directories.

title: touch
content: Create an empty file or update file timestamps.

title: cat
content: Display the content of files to standard output.

title: echo
content: Print text or variables to standard output.

title: chmod
content: Change file permissions.

title: chown
content: Change the owner or group of a file.

title: grep
content: Search for text patterns in files.

title: find
content: Search for files and directories in a directory hierarchy.

title: locate
content: Quickly find files by name using a database.

title: man
content: Display the manual pages for commands.

title: head
content: Show the first lines of a file.

title: tail
content: Show the last lines of a file, often used with log files.

title: tar
content: Archive multiple files into a single file or extract archives.

title: zip
content: Compress files into a ZIP archive.

title: unzip
content: Extract files from a ZIP archive.

title: wget
content: Download files from the web via HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP.

title: curl
content: Transfer data from or to a server using various protocols.

title: ps
content: Display information about running processes.

title: kill
content: Send a signal to a process, often to stop it.

title: top
content: Monitor system processes in real time.

title: htop
content: An interactive process viewer with enhanced features.

title: df
content: Display disk space usage for file systems.

title: du
content: Show disk usage for files and directories.

title: sudo
content: Execute commands with superuser privileges.

title: ps aux
content: Display detailed information about all running processes.

title: df -h
content: Show disk space usage in human-readable format.

title: df -i
content: Show inode usage for mounted filesystems.

title: du -sh
content: Display total size of a file or directory in human-readable format.

title: rsync -av
content: Synchronize directories while preserving attributes.

title: rsync -aHAX --delete
content: Create a full mirror sync preserving ACLs, hardlinks and attributes.

title: tar -czvf
content: Create a compressed gzip tar archive.

title: find / -name
content: Search for files by name starting at root.

title: sed -i
content: Edit files in-place using stream substitutions.

title: awk
content: A powerful text processing and pattern scanning tool.

title: netstat -tuln
content: List all listening TCP and UDP ports.

title: kill -9
content: Forcefully terminate a process.

title: whoami
content: Print the current logged-in user.

title: man
content: Display the manual page for commands.

title: history
content: Show the shell command history.

title: clear
content: Clear the terminal screen.

title: uname -a
content: Print detailed system information.

title: uptime
content: Show how long the system has been running.

title: strace
content: Trace system calls and signals of a process.

title: lsof -i
content: List processes using specific network ports.

title: ip route show
content: Display the system's routing table.

title: mount -o remount,rw
content: Remount a filesystem with read/write permissions.

title: journalctl
content: Query and view systemd logs.

title: tcpdump
content: Capture and analyze network packets.

title: chroot
content: Run a command with a different filesystem as root.

title: systemctl isolate
content: Switch to another systemd target (runlevel).

title: ulimit
content: Control user resource limits, such as open files.

title: ifconfig
content: Display or configure network interfaces.

title: tty
content: Print the file name of the terminal connected to stdin.

title: Introduction to Computer Science
content: Comprehensive guide covering fundamentals of programming, algorithms, and data structures.

title: Data Structures Tutorial
content: Learn about arrays, linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and graphs with practical examples.

title: Networking Basics
content: Understanding TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, and network protocols essential for modern computing.
